metadata.title: CVE-2023-44271 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Pillow before 10.0.0. It is a Denial of Servicethat uncontrollably allocates memory to process a given task, potentiallycausing a service to crash by having it run out of memory. This occurs fortruetype in ImageFont when textlength in an ImageDraw instance operates ona long text argument.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-44271` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.8
python3-pil.imagetk - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.0-4ubuntu0.8').
pillow-python2 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
